brainly_data.question: The Kwans are saving for their daughter’s college education. If they deposit $12,000 in an account bearing 6.4% interest compounded continuously, how much will be in the account when Ann goes to college in 12 years?
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.question: The Kwans are saving for their daughter’s college education. If they deposit $12,000 in an account bearing 6.4% interest compounded continuously, how much will be in the account when Ann goes to college in 12 years?
all_answers.subject: Mathematics
all_answers.text:
(See attached graphic).
Total = Principal * e ^ (rate * years)
Total = 12,000 * 2.718281828 ^ (.064 * 12)
Total = 12,000 * 2.718281828 ^ .768
Total =
12,000 * 
2.1554510377

Total =

25,865.41

Source:
http://www.1728.org/rate2.htm
